So, I just want to address some of the negative reviews out there. At least the common complaints.

1. The bugs - Yes, it always has new and  growing bugs, they fix and more show. They DO fix them though and are always working to do so. Some are funny, some enraging, but they do get fixed.

2. "The devs don't listen" - This is an old arguement. The devs have grown a lot and are listening more now, but its still their game and they will change how they please ultimately. There are def some things I'd like to see changed, namely the Keys and mori's... but they are working to balance. They are just a little slow.

3. Community is toxic - Honestly, I've seen it, but I've seen plenty of wholesome and fun. Whats more, is I've seen plenty of clips and streams where people having fun and goofing around are called "Toxic". This misconception causes a lot of these complaints. There is no real "Winning" in the game, its what you make of it, what "YOU" consider winning. I personally play to have fun, and it's a blast!

And to end the review, I just wanna say: This game is only as fun as you make it to be. You try to take it too seriously and sweat real hard, its gonna be frustrating at times. That being said though... my only real issue is how much the Killer dictates the "Amount of fun" you can have in a game. If you get a guy that face camps a single person waiting with an instant down and a mori. You're not gonna have a lot of fun. You generally will only see this in very low ranks because this tactic doesn't give you many points. So tank through it and get past them.

The more you play the better you'll get, obviously, but exponentially in this game due to the gaining of more perks. Have fun out there!

As much as I want to recommend this mess of a game due to the fact that I do have fun (sometimes) playing it, and that almost 5 years later it's still relevant. I can't. This game is extremely flawed anywhere you look at it, its glitchy, unbalanced, and toxic. Solo queuing as a survivor is the most infuriating thing you can do cause you get paired with potatoes that self-care in the corner; Being a killer means get ready to get t-bagged by survivors while you are a baby killer cause the matchmaking is non-existent. Or get accused by SWF of camping or tunneling because not all of them escaped. Long story short, If you aren't super competitive, have patience, anger management, and love to hate things then I say give it a try; Cause you will find a "je ne sais quoi" that will make you come back regardless of how trash it is. Otherwise I say stay away....for your own good.

PD: This is not a competitive game as most of the community likes to make it seem. There's no e-sports so no need to be a tryhard. Have fun, and for Pete's sake do gens.

Very fun game, extremely entertaining with a group of friends and always new content on the horizon. Definitely worth picking up if you have a squad to play with and you want to buy something new over a sale.

Have you ever watched a Horror Movie and thought "Man, these survivors are so STUPID, i can do so much better than this?" or "I could kill these dumbf*** SO much better than this killer!" 

Well do i have the game for you! 

Dead By Daylight, where death is NOT an escape. You can choose from either one of 30+ survivors or 30+ killers, some from your favorite horror movies/shows, like Micheal Myers, Leatherface, Ghostface, or the Demogorgon! Escape or Kill, it's your choice! play with friends? Kill your friends? have fun with it! totally worth the amount of DLC they have released for this game, with Seasons, and different events, there's never a dull moment, get this game today!!

Engaging, at time intense and insanely frustrating in a way that makes you feel like you have to come back to it. This game is an exceptional example of how to do asymmetrical multi-player right. There‚Äôs a decent variety to the roster of characters on both sides and the strength of their original content is very much a force in game. The only weakness this game has is its fanbase which is straight trash.
